course.title: Biology of the Cancer Cell
course.faculty_text: David A. Frank (Medical School) and Jean J. Zhao (Medical School)
course.description: This semester long course takes a molecular approach to examine the basis of human cancer. The main concepts that we will cover include: tumor suppressor genes and oncogenes, signal transduction, DNA damage and repair, angiogenesis, metastasis and invasion, and apoptosis. Lectures will be delivered by experts in the various fields of Cancer Biology research to provide an integrated perspective on past, current and future approaches in Cancer Biology Research.
course.prerequisites: Advanced biochemistry, molecular genetics, and cell biology.
course.notes: Given alternate years with Cell Biology 211.
